channel.title: [317] Safe area's
channel.description:
Starting my new server from a blank source,
I'm making home at entara island, But other players can attack each other ?
How do i Make it so they can't?
thanks.

item.title: [317] Safe area's
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

How blank is your source? Lol…

Just declare this method the same as you declared the boolean earlier (isInWilderness)

public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
        if (Type == 1) {
            if ((coordY >= 3520) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392)
                    && (coordX >= 2942)) {
                return true;
            }
        } else if (Type == 2) {
            if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392)
                    && (coordX >= 2942)) {
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    }

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Safe area's
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

First there should be something like this:

            outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
            outStream.writeByteC(3);
            outStream.writeByteA(1);
            outStream.writeString("Attack");
            outStream.endFrameVarSize();
            isInWilderness = true;

This will send the Attack option, so you just need to add this to your process:

// wilderness check
        if ((isInWilderness(absX, absY, 1))
                && (isInWilderness == false)) {
            outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
            outStream.writeByteC(3); // command slot (does it matter which
            // one?)
            outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed
            // on top in context menu
            outStream.writeString("Attack");
            outStream.endFrameVarSize();
            isInWilderness = true;
        } else  if ((isInWilderness(absX, absY, 1) == false) && isInWilderness == true) {
                // Not in wilderness, but the variable thinks they are
               outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
               outStream.writeByteC(3);
               outStream.writeByteA(1);
               outStream.writeString("null");
               outStream.endFrameVarSize();
               isInWilderness = false;      
        }

This basically just checks if they’re in the wilderness or not, and if they are then it sends the attack option, and if not then it deletes it.

Note: If you don’t have the methods/variables used in this snippet then you will get errors, just tell me and i will reply with the variables and methods required.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Safe area's

@Snaz wrote:

Well can you just tell me how to make the attack option not available unless you’re in the wilderness, Will help alot, Thanks (:

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Safe area's
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Find the attack player packet, which is packet 73.

Then after case 73:

Put the following code:

int target = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
                if (isSafe(target) || isSafe(PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(playerName))) {
                    sendMessage("You cannot attack this player here.");
                    break;
                }

Then add this method (and edit the variables to declare where is safe.

public boolean isSafe(int ID) {
        if (ID != -1) {
            client player = (client) PlayerHandler.players[ID];
            if (
                    (player.absX >= #### && player.absX <= #### && player.absY >= #### && player.absY <= ####)
            ) {
            return true; // Is safe
            }
        }
        return false;
    }

^ Change the hashes to the coords that create the range where you want to be attack-free.

Additionally, you should make the attack option not appear if you aren’t in the “wilderness”.

Just to be clear, this is not the most effective way, nor the most efficient way to disable player attacking outside of the “wilderness”, but this is what you asked for, so i done it for you.

Read full topic
